place.name: GLYNTAWE
place.gazetteerText: GLYNTAWE, a hamlet-chapelry in Devynnock parish, Breconshire; 7½ miles W of Brecon town and r. station. Post town, Brecon. Pop., 99. Houses, 20. The living is a p. curacy in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £80. Patron, the Vicar of Devynnock. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
